Great title. Someone is probably forming a band with this name as I type...

Thank you, LOC for joining flickr. I hope other institutions follow your lead and share their material!

comment._content: In looking at the hi-res versions provided at the Persistent URL link above, one of them is indeed pointing his gun at the camera.

comment.author: 20194820@N00
comment._content: It looks like the kid behind the one with the gun is pointing his finger at the camera, pretend-gun style.

comment.author: 53461717@N08
comment._content:
By call nr. the photo can be located on the hills south to Ciudad Juarez, around February 3-4, 1911.  It could be part of a series that may be named "Rebels in Orozco's Camp" before Juárez was attacked.  
The San Francisco Call, issue February 4, 1911 (The Library of Congress, Cronicling America), says:  "The Associated Press operator here, who had returned from a visit  to Orozco's camp, located 18 kilometers south of Juarez, says that Orozco told him he was waiting for Blanco's arrival tonight before attacking Juarez;"
Dr. Roberto Duarte
Plastic Surgeon
